title: Neymar reveals he DID want to leave PSG in summer but has now vowed to give his 'best' for club
text:
Neymar has confirmed that he wanted to leave PSG in the summer and was not happy at the French club.

A prospective switch back to Barcelona was one of the most talked about transfer moves of the offseason but his dream failed to transpire.

At times it had appeared as though an agreement was close and Neymar's watch sponsor even posted an image of the forward in a Barcelona again, before swiftly deleting it.

Neymar admitted trying to leave PSG but said he will give his all for the French club

NEYMAR'S STATS THIS SEASON: Matches - 5 Goals - 4 Assists - 0 Shots - 21

Neymar made no secret of his desire to leave PSG after just two years having become the world's most expensive player when he joined for £198million in 2017.

But he has now spoken publicly for the first time since his move back to Barcelona fell through.

'I think when you're not happy, regardless of what your job is, you try to change, you try to find new places, a new profession so that you can find yourself,' he told Otro.

'So, this is what I tried to do. But I ended up staying. And, as I mentioned, I will give my best.

'I will give 100 per cent on the pitch and try to bring victories to Paris, especially in the Champions League.'

Neymar (left) denied a rift with Kylian Mbappe (right) and described him as an 'incredible kid'

Some have questioned the relationship with Kylian Mbappe as the duo were reported to have clashed last season.

On the subject, Neymar added: 'With Kylian it’s different. He speaks French, he’s French, and I’m Brazilian. We get on very well. He’s an incredible kid. Not to mention his football, which is amazing.'

It wasn't just Neymar's relationship with Mbappe that was called into question as large sections of PSG fans reacted angrily at what they deemed as public disrespect and betrayal.

His appearances for Thomas Tuchel's side have been met with whistles since but he believes the tension is cooling off now.

The forward is out of action for the next four weeks with a hamstring injury

Neymar continued: 'Soon the love will return, God willing. It is normal, I understand their feelings too.

'I can try to understand what goes on in their minds but I ask them to understand me too.

'I compared it to a relationship between a man and a woman. You always end up fighting and it is part of any relationship. Later you make peace and the love returns.'

The 27-year-old has been plagued by injury problems in recent months and is currently sidelined for four weeks with a strained hamstring.
description: Neymar has confirmed that he wanted to leave PSG in the summer and was not happy at the French club. He has pledged to do his best while he remains in Paris.
